A **wand of acid** is a type of [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") that appears in [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). In Hack'EM, the item is renamed to the **wand of corrosion**.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
- [4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

An [Acid Mage](/wiki/Acid_Mage "Acid Mage") will always receive a wand of acid, and [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may randomly receive one in their starting inventory.

## Description

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") a wand of acid shoots an [acidic](/wiki/Acid "Acid") [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") similar to a [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon")'s [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") attack. Like many other acid-based attacks, the acid ray can [corrode](/wiki/Corrode "Corrode") [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") and [copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper") weapons and armor, and will destroy any [doors](/wiki/Door "Door") it hits. Every time an acid ray hits a target, there is a 1⁄6 chance of affecting the target's weapon, and a separate 1 in 6 chance 1⁄6 chance of affecting the target's armor. If a player wielding [two weapons](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") is hit by the acid, each weapon has a 1⁄3 chance of being affected.

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") yourself with the wand deals 8d6 damage unless you have [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"). Being hit by a ray of acid from the wand or zapping yourself will cure [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning").

[Applyying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a wand of acid to break it causes an explosion of noxious gas which deals double the ray's damage to you and surrounding creatures.

Attempting to [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") with a wand of acid returns the message "The bugs on the \<floor> seem to be covered in goo!" which can be used to identify the wand, though the wand does not self-identify. Engravings made this way are non-permanent.

## SpliceHack

| /               |                                                                                 |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name            | acid                                                                            |
| Appearance      | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance")                   |
| Base price      | 175 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                               |
| Weight          | 7                                                                               |
| Type            | ray                                                                             |
| Maximum charges | 8                                                                               |
| Monster use     | *May be used [offensively](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item") by monsters.* |

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), engraving with this wand auto-identifies it and always [burns](/wiki/Burn "Burn") an engraving. This makes it a nice substitute for a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire").

When this wand explodes (from breaking or cursed backfire) it deals (8 \* charges remaining).

Acid rays can also be used to melt [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars"), provided they are on a level that doesn't prevent them from being destroyed.

Zapping yourself is more lethal than SlashTHEM, resulting in 12d6 acid damage.

## Hack'EM

| /               |                                                                                 |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name            | corrosion                                                                       |
| Appearance      | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance")                   |
| Base price      | 175 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                               |
| Weight          | 7                                                                               |
| Type            | ray                                                                             |
| Maximum charges | 8                                                                               |
| Monster use     | *May be used [offensively](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item") by monsters.* |

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") it was renamed to the **wand of corrosion** to avoid naming conflicts with [potions of acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid"). It was ported from SpliceHack with some minor tweaks. Acid rays (from the wand of corrosion or monster breath) can destroy [webs](/wiki/Web "Web"), [trees](/wiki/Tree "Tree"), [dead trees](/wiki/Dead_tree "Dead tree"), and [grass](/wiki/Grass "Grass"). [Fountains](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), [toilets](/wiki/Toilet "Toilet"), [sinks](/wiki/Sink "Sink"), and [rust traps](/wiki/Rust_trap "Rust trap") that are hit will also cause an alchemical blast and likely destroy the dungeon feature in the process.

Breaking this wand deals (4 x charges remaining x 3) damage [\[1\]](#cite_note-1) with a chance of creating a [magic beam trap](/index.php?title=Magic_beam_trap\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Magic beam trap (page does not exist)") depending on how many charges were left.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
